related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Account Linking Problem

**Key Points:**

* User johnkennyuk reported an issue with account linking not working properly.
* This issue seems to be caused by a capitalization difference in the first character of the email address associated with the user's Github account compared to their Google account.
* The user prefers to keep their Google account as the main account.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly and not functioning properly.
* A capitalization difference in the first character of the email address is causing the accounts to not link correctly.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user's Github account was reset to allow for another attempt at linking accounts.
* The user was advised to check their Github account settings to ensure email privacy settings are disabled.
* The user was advised to manually adjust the capitalization of the first character in their Github account email to match their Google account email.
* The company is actively developing a new authentication service that will address these issues and enable linking of different accounts with varying email addresses.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user's accounts are still not linked due to the capitalization difference in the email address.
* The user has decided to wait for the new authentication service to be implemented before attempting to link their accounts again.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new authentication service is expected to be ready for production by the end of February 2025.
* The company is confident that the new service will resolve the account linking issues.


I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any additional questions.

* Other applications like Atlas OS are installed on the machine.
* User has tried several steps to troubleshoot the issue, including:

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to boot or launch, often after an update. This can be due to installing an incorrect version for their architecture (e.g., Intel vs. ARM on macOS) or issues with core dependencies. Solutions include reinstalling the correct version, ensuring dependencies are met, or following debugging steps provided by support.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Ollama installation fails in Pieces app due to missing `curl` program.
* This is caused by Pieces OS running in a sandboxed environment.
* Snaps currently do not include `curl` as a dependency.
* This impacts both downloading and inference of local LLM models.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces app incorrectly assumes `curl` is available.
* Sandboxed environment restricts access to external programs.
* Installing Ollama manually is ineffective due to sandbox limitations.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patching the Pieces app to allow Ollama usage within a sandbox environment.
* Adding `curl` as a dependency in the snap definition file.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists as of 2023-11-23.
* No current workarounds are available for snap installations.
* Users are awaiting a fix from the Pieces team.
* The delay is due to prioritizing critical infrastructure updates.

**Timeline:**

* Issue reported: 2024-12-18
* Fix reported in progress: 2025-01-23
* Developer resumes work on fix: 2025-01-28
* Fix expected: 2023-11-23 

**Additional Comments:**

* Users are frustrated with the delay and eager for a resolution.
* Some users are seeking alternative solutions for accessing local LLM models.
* There's concern about data privacy and reliance on cloud-based LLMs.
